posts.post_content: Heathen as it may sound, I'm not really a fan of Chain Lightning. At least they're not nearly as expensive to pick up as these things.

Posted By: Minus_Prime (2/21/2011 9:06:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
For purposes other than targeting yourself or your own creatures and powering shenanigans, this card seems strictly worse than Lightning Bolt.  
  
It's at sorcery speed, and it can potentially give your opponent a critical advantage.  
  
Don't get me wrong, lightning bolt is hard to compete with, but this seems like a poor substitute. They should really be more subtle about letting you sneak four more copies of lightning bolt into your decks.
posts.html:
For purposes other than targeting yourself or your own creatures and powering shenanigans, this card seems strictly worse than Lightning Bolt.

It's at sorcery speed, and it can potentially give your opponent a critical advantage.

Don't get me wrong, lightning bolt is hard to compete with, but this seems like a poor substitute. They should really be more subtle about letting you sneak four more copies of lightning bolt into your decks.

Posted By: RazzmatazzTheGreat (11/22/2010 7:50:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: For the longest time I was a real fool and then it finally hit me that this card actually is really good. The [Stuffy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy Doll) combo simply illustrates the fact you can target yourself and your own creatures. You can still run this and blast a 1/1 goblin token while running off a couple [Seething Song](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seething Song)s to nail your opponent for lots of damage. I'm sorry for ever having doubted this card. 5/5
posts.html:

Posted By: Totema (4/6/2012 9:33:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@limbrooke, you can't do that. You can copy it only once each time, so if you copy it again you'd have to choose to target another of your creatures or yourself, or your opponent. You can shoot your self/guys as many times as you have mana, but you only get to shoot your opponent once.  
  
Stuffy Doll works because it puts the damage from the original and copies onto the opponent. You never change targets.
posts.html:
@limbrooke, you can't do that. You can copy it only once each time, so if you copy it again you'd have to choose to target another of your creatures or yourself, or your opponent. You can shoot your self/guys as many times as you have mana, but you only get to shoot your opponent once.

Stuffy Doll works because it puts the damage from the original and copies onto the opponent. You never change targets.

Posted By: Zinn11 (11/10/2011 10:43:43 AM)

posts.post_content:
I agree with Grimjaws and other people who aren't raving about this card. Its way too expensive to run a set of these and lightning bolt, just so you can have 8 bolts? You might as well just use a spike, as already pointed out.  
  
I have one only because of the premium deck and I must say it looks awesome, but honestly I would never buy this card for 10 bucks. My deck is not built to target my own creatures so without that this card is simply a sorcery speed bolt to me...  
  
And Minus\_prime, no one runs [dispel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dispel), or any other countering spell that limits what you can counter from what I've seen because its too specific. It's all about [counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=counterspell), [mana leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mana leak), hell, even [cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cancel) for those budget players.
